result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Luke C. Messer

records.addlTxt: 11:48 AM Defendant Luke C. Messer in court, via telephone with attorney Cana G Kohn, via zoom.  Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared for the State of Wisconsin, via zoom.   Atty Kohn is requesting contact be allowed determined by case worker. State gives statement and will moves to amend no contact,  No contact with alleged victims. except as establish in Chips order.  Court will amend conditions from No contact with alleged child victims to no contact with child victims,  except as determined by supervising case social worker.Atty Kohn will waive time limits for p.h. and request Status.  Reply by State.  21CF35 to track.  Copy of minutes given to jail  Status conference scheduled for May 2, 2022 at 11:00 am.

03:32 PM Defendant Luke C. Messer in court with attorney Cana G Kohn.  Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Motion to Dismiss, State has reviewed motion to dismiss, and has filed an amended complaint.  Atty Kohn is satisfied. Atty Kohn heard on bond conditions.   Atty Kohn has copy of amended complaint, and no longer needs motion to dismiss addressed.  State is not prepared to be heard on bond conditions. Atty Kohn waives time limits for p.h.  Def. agrees to waive time limits for p.h. Court accepts waiver of time limits for p.h. Atty Kohn and def. will be allowed to appear via zoom/telephone.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for April 21, 2022 at 11:45 am.

Letter on Request to Address Bond Term
Routed to CC-JA
Maintain Absolute Sobriety.  No illegal use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription. No contact with alleged victims.

01:29 PM Defendant Luke C. Messer in court with attorney Cana G Kohn, via zoom.  Kelly L Hays appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Kohn has copy of complaint, and has filed motion to dismiss complaint, needs to set bond.  CC noties motion.  State has not reviewed motion to dismiss.  State would like to reschedule initial appearance.  CC will not set bond today. Atty Kohn would like next appearance to be set via zoom.  CC is going to set bond and not have initial appearance today. State gives bail/bond recommendation. Atty Kohn heard on no contact provision dealing with Shawano Co Social Serv. Court orders conditions Maintain Absolute Sobriety.  No illegal use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription. No contact with alleged victims. $5,000 Signature bond. Atty Kohn heard on no contact provision.  CC gives ruling.  Initial appearance scheduled for April 19, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Defendant's Motion to Dismiss the Complaint
